alert.note: Alert for Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 04 at 1:17PM CDT until April 11 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following areas, Lee and Ogle. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 115 PM CDT, emergency management has reported multiple areas of standing water across Ogle County. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen with previously thunderstorms. - Little additional rainfall is expected over the next 30 minutes, but standing water is likely to remain for the next few hours. - Some locations that may continue to see flooding include... Dixon, Rochelle, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Davis Junction, Forreston, Hillcrest, Stillman Valley, Franklin Grove, Ashton, Lost Nation, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Leaf River, Grand Detour, Steward and Nelson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
